    * Billing and customer service for subscribers
    * Interfacing with the utility company

        * Inc. (Incorporated)
        * Corporation
        * Trust

## Finding the Customer in a Community Solar Agreement

Given a community solar agreement, identify and extract section of the text that define the entity of the Customer, it would be one of the party in the agreement, usually in the first page clauses.

* Look for phrases like:
    * "This Agreement" or "This [Document Type]"
    * "Subscriber"
    * "Customer"
    * "Beneficiary" (especially if related to energy credits)
    * "Owner"
* Identify company names, often followed by identifiers such as:
    * LLC (Limited Liability Company)
    * limited liability company
    * Inc. (Incorporated)
    * Corporation
    * Trust
    * Individual names
* Look for addresses associated with the company or individual names.
* Pay attention to quotation marks surrounding names or titles, and parentheses often containing additional information.
* Look for patterns like:
    * **[Company Name], a [State] [Company Type], with an address at [Address] (the "Customer")**
    * **between [Company/Individual Name] (the "Company") and [Company/Individual Name] (the "Customer")**

**Example:**

>This SUBSCRIBER MANAGEMENT AGREEMENT is made and entered into as of [DATE] ("Effective Date") by and between [Customer], LLC, an Oregon Limited Liability Company ("Owner"), and Neighbourhood Power OR, LLC, an Oregon Limited Liability Company ("Operator"). Each of owner and Operator shall be referred to herein as a "Party" and collectively, as the "Parties".

>"**This Master Services Agreement (the “Agreement”) dated as
of the [DATE] (the “Effective Date”) is
between [Provider], a [Provider] corporation (“Ampion”),
and [Customer], LLC, a Delaware limited
liability company (“Client”). All capitalized terms used
herein shall have the meanings ascribed in the Glossary
attached hereto.**"

>"**This Master Services Agreement (the “Agreement”) dated as of the [DATE] (the “Effective Date”) is between [Provider], LLC, a [Provider] limited liability company, doing business as “SunCentral” (“Company”), and
[Customer], LLC, a New York limited liability company (“Client”). Company and Client shall each individually be
referred to hereafter as a “Party” and collectively as the “Parties”.**"

## Finding the Term of Agreement in a document

**Prompt:**

Given a legal document related to a community solar garden, identify and extract the section that defines the "Term" of the agreement. This refers to the duration during which the Provider manages the community solar garden and the Customer subscribes to it.

**Keywords and Patterns:**

* Look for headings or sections titled:
    * "Term"
    * "Agreement Term"
    * "Duration"
    * "Term of Agreement"
* Look for phrases like:
    * "This Agreement shall commence on..."
    * "The term of this Agreement shall continue for a period of..."
    * "unless the Parties mutually agree to terminate..."
    * "subject to early termination pursuant to Section..."
* Identify specific time periods mentioned, such as:
    * Number of years (e.g., 5 years, 20 years)
* Pay attention to clauses discussing:
    * Commencement date (e.g., "Effective Date")
    * Termination conditions
    * Extension possibilities

**Example:**

In the phrase:

>"**8.1 Term. The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date, and shall continue for a period of Twenty (20) years unless the Parties mutually agree to terminate prior to the end of the period or subject to early termination pursuant to Section 8.2.**"
>"**1.1 Agreement Term. This Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date and will continue until the third (3rd) anniversary ...
* "8.1 Term" clearly labels the section as defining the Term.

* "The term of this Agreement shall commence on the Effective Date" specifies the start date.
* "continue for a period of Twenty (20) years" explicitly states the duration.
* "unless the Parties mutually agree to terminate" and "subject to early termination pursuant to Section 8.2" highlight conditions for ending the agreement before the 20-year period.

## Finding Payment Remittance Clauses in a Document

**Prompt:**

Given a contract, identify and extract sections of text that detail the payment remittance process, including payment terms, schedules, methods, and any related financial handling procedures. 

**Keywords and Patterns:**

* **General Payment Terms:**
    * "Payment"
    * "Fee(s)"
    * "Invoice"
    * "Compensation"
    * "Remittance"
    * "Payment Terms"
    * "Payment Schedule"
    * "Method of Payment"
    * "Wire Transfer"
    * "ACH Payment"
    * "Check"
    * "Electronic Payment"
* **Timeframes:**
    * "Due Date"
    * "Net [Number] Days" (e.g., Net 30 Days)
    * "Monthly"
    * "Quarterly"
    * "Annually"
    * "In Arrears"
    * "Upon Receipt"
    * "Within [Number] Days"
* **Specific Clauses:**
    * Look for headings or sections titled:
        * "Payment Terms"
        * "Payment of Fees"
        * "Invoicing and Payment"
        * "Financial Terms"
        * "Compensation"
* **Examples:**
    * "Contractor shall invoice Client monthly for services rendered."
    * "Payment is due within 30 days of receipt of invoice."
    * "All payments shall be made via electronic funds transfer."

**Focus on:**

* Identify the parties responsible for making and receiving payments.
* Extract specific details about payment amounts, due dates, and acceptable payment methods.
* Look for clauses outlining late payment penalties or consequences of non-payment. 

**Example:**

In the phrase:

>"**4.2.1 Payment Mechanics. Company shall provide Client with an invoice for the One-Time Fee... Company shall not initiate any work... until the One-Time Fee is paid in-full... Company will provide Client with an electronic invoice for the Recurring Fee...**"

* "Payment Mechanics" clearly indicates this section relates to payment procedures.
* "Company" and "Client" are identified as the parties involved in the transaction.
* "One-Time Fee" and "Recurring Fee" suggest different payment types or schedules.
* "Invoice," "paid in-full," and "electronic invoice" provide details about the invoicing and payment process.
